column4: Italy anti-trust fines Apple for misleading customers
column5: ROME Italy's anti-trust body has fined units of U.S. technology group Apple Inc a total of 900 000 euros for failing to adequately inform customers about their rights to product guarantees and assistance.

column4: Samsung eyes 15 percent rise in handset sales next year: report
column5: SEOUL South Korea's Samsung Electronics aims to raise its global handset sales by 15 percent next year by boosting its smartphone sales  putting it in a closer race with bigger rival Nokia  a local newspaper said on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Cal-Maine Foods Q2 profit jumps; shares rise
column5: Dec 27 Cal-Maine Foods Inc's  second-quarter profit rose more than 50 percent as strong demand for eggs and higher average selling prices helped the company overcome rising feed costs.

column5: * Expects Q4 gross margins to be about 1 pct point lower than prior view

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Sears to close 100-120 Kmart  Sears Full-line stores
column5: Dec 27 Retailer Sears Holdings Corp  said it plans to close 100-120 Kmart and Sears Full-line stores and expects its adjusted fourth-quarter EBITDA to more than halve from a year ago.

column4: Appeals court to review BofA $8.5 billion MBS pact
column5: A U.S. appeals court agreed to resolve a dispute among institutional investors over whether Bank of America Corp's $8.5 billion mortgage debt settlement should be sent back to a New York state court for approval.

column4: UPDATE 1-India's Tata Power to buy out BP stake in solar JV
column5: MUMBAI  Dec 27 Indian utility Tata Power Ltd said on Tuesday it would buy out BP Alternative Energy Holding's 51 percent stake in joint venture Tata BP Solar for an undisclosed amount.

column4: Appeals court delays SEC-Citigroup fraud case
column5: The Securities and Exchange Commission won a delay in its securities fraud lawsuit against Citigroup Inc  as the regulator tries to appeal a judge's decision to reject its $285 million settlement with the bank.

column4: UPDATE 2-Endeavour buys U.K. oil fields assets for $330 mln
column5: Dec 27 Endeavour International Corp  said its unit has agreed to buy ConocoPhillips'  interest in three producing U.K. oil fields for $330 million  bulking up the U.S. oil and gas exploration company's North Sea assets.

column4: Edison debt to be cut by 1.1 bln euros-EDF CFO
column5: PARIS  Dec 27 Italian utility Edison's  debt would be reduced by 1.1 billion euros ($1.43 billion) if EDF's takeover bid goes through  the French state-controlled power company's chief financial officer said on Tuesday.

column4: A2A sees closing of Edison deal by end-June
column5: MILAN  Dec 27 Italian regional utility A2A  expects to close the reorganisation of shareholdings in Italian power generator Edison  announced by partner EDF on Tuesday  by the end of June 2012  A2A said in a statement.

column4: Edison shareholders reach deal on revamp
column5: PARIS  Dec 27 French utility EDF  and a group of Italian shareholders have reached a new preliminary deal on the reorganisation of Edison  with EDF raising its stake in Italy's second biggest utility and Edison's Italian shareholders gaining ownership of its affiliate Edipower.

column4: UPDATE 1-Enterprise Products to sell 22.8 mln Energy Transfer units
column5: Dec 27 Enterprise Products Partners LP  said it will sell 22.8 million Energy Transfer Equity L.P. units to undisclosed buyers for about $825 million.

column4: Oil rises on Iran warning on Strait of Hormuz
column5: NEW YORK Oil rose for a sixth straight session on Tuesday as Iran's threat to stop oil moving through the Strait of Hormuz added to concerns about potential threats to supplies from the region. | Video

column4: UPDATE 1-Fidelity National to sell majority stake in personal lines business
column5: Dec 27 Fidelity National Financial Inc   the No. 1 U.S. property title insurer  said it will sell an 85 percent interest in its personal lines business to WT Holdings for about $119 million.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 2-Freeport Indonesia union says halts return to work after strike
column5: JAKARTA  Dec 27 Workers at Freeport McMoran Copper & Gold Inc's mine in Indonesia halted on Tuesday their return to work after a three-month strike  pending the resolution of a labour dispute  senior union officials said.

column4: Freeport Indonesia union says halts return to work post strike
column5: JAKARTA  Dec 27 The union at Freeport McMoRan Copper & Gold Inc's Grasberg mine in Indonesia has halted a return to work after a three-month strike pending the resolution of a local labour dispute  senior union official Virgo Solossa said on Tuesday.

column5: Two Eastman Kodak  directors resigned from the board last week  the struggling photography company said in a filing with U.S. regulators on Tuesday.

column4: From Macy's to Sears  tales of holiday highs  lows
column5: Macy's Inc  and Wal-Mart Stores Inc  continue to get high marks from Wall Street as the busy season draws to a close  while Sears Holdings Corp  proved that it was really not a jolly holiday for all stores. | Video

column4: From Macy's to Sears  tales of holiday highs  lows
column5: Macy's Inc   Wal-Mart  and others continue to get high marks from Wall Street as the busy season draws to a close  while Sears Holdings Corp  proved that it was really not a jolly holiday for all stores.

column4: GE jumps into retail banking with MetLife deal
column5: General Electric Co  agreed to buy life insurer MetLife Inc's  online bank on Tuesday  in a deal that will let GE's capital arm expand its funding base and lessen reliance on wholesale markets.

column4: NY Times Co to sell regional newspapers for $143 million
column5: The New York Times Co said it will sell 16 regional newspapers spread across the U.S. Southeast and California to Halifax Media Holdings for $143 million in cash as it looks to cut costs and focus on its most important papers and their websites.

column4: UPDATE 2-NY Times Co to sell regional newspapers for $143 mln
column5: Dec 27 The New York Times Co said it will sell 16 regional newspapers spread across the U.S. Southeast and California to Halifax Media Holdings for $143 million in cash as it looks to cut costs and focus on its most important papers and their websites.

column4: Robinson exit to cost New York Times over $15 million
column5: Janet Robinson  who will step down as chief executive of the New York Times Co on December 31  will receive an exit package in excess of $15 million  according to people familiar with the situation.

column4: ON THE MOVE: Raymond James hires Wells Fargo  UBS advisers
column5: Dec 27 Raymond James has hired two former Wells Fargo advisers and one former UBS adviser who together managed more than $500 million to open the firm's first office in Jackson  Mississippi  the company said on Tuesday.

column4: Sony to sell LCD venture stake to Samsung for $940 million
column5: TOKYO/SEOUL Sony Corp has agreed to sell its nearly 50 percent stake in an LCD joint venture with Samsung Electronics to the South Korean company for $940 million  as it struggles to reduce huge losses at its TV business. | Video

column4: UPDATE 2-Ventas to buy Cogdell Spencer for $217 mln
column5: Dec 27 Healthcare real estate firm Ventas Inc will buy peer Cogdell Spencer Inc for about $217 million in cash to broaden its presence in the medical office building market.
